channel.title: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network
channel.description:
From what I gather, default behavior is to have gateway with NAT adapter and Internal network adapter, workstation with just internal network adapter. We now have a fairly new feature in VB called NAT Network. This makes using 2 ifaces on the gateway redundant. In the meantime, how can I successfully set it up this way for myself? I have both VMs set to NAT Network but now workstation can't connect out.
Maybe if I just mirror the previous IP addresses. Will try again.

item.title: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
SSH into Whonix-Workstation is documented here:

whonix.org – 22 Mar 20

File Transfer - Whonix

Copying files into and out of Whonix ™ Virtual Machines.

whonix.org – 31 Dec 19

SSHFS into Whonix-Workstation - Whonix

Mount Whonix-Workstation ™ files on your Host using sshfs

Read full topic
item.source: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network

item.title: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network
item.dc:creator: Trioxin
item.description:
I came up with workarounds to accomplish it. Basically, port forwarding/hopping through the vbox NAT, to the gate, to each WS, opening local host ports.

For instance, if I map the gateway port 22 to vbox NAT port 2222 then I can:

ssh -L 2121:workstation1:21 user@127.0.0.1 -p 2222

where workstation1 is the hostname (Specified in /etc/hosts on gateway) on the virtual network of the machine I want to be able to connect to on port 21 via local port 2121.

Read full topic
item.source: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network

item.title: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
• Whonix-Gateway can connect to these open port.
  • Host cannot connect to that open port.
  • Open internet cannot connect to that open port.
  • When using multiple workstations behind same Whonix-Gateway this is an
    issue too.
whonix.org – 17 Sep 19

Multiple Whonix-Workstation ™ - Whonix

Compartmentalization. Better separation of different tasks and/or pseudonyms by using multiple Whonix-Workstation ™.

whonix.org – 25 Apr 19

Connections between Whonix-Gateway ™ and Whonix-Workstation ™ - Whonix

Authenticated / Encrypted Connections between Whonix-Gateway ™ and Whonix-Workstation ™, ARP spoofing defense, SSH, OpenVPN, Using additional (isolated) network interfaces

Read full topic
item.source: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network

item.title: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network
item.dc:creator: Trioxin
item.description:
What I’m wanting to do is administer multiple workstations from the host via SSH. The documentation suggests that to do this, I should hop from the gateway to the workstations. This seems bad to me because you’re opening ports on the one VM that actually is connected to the outside Internet (Though admittedly through Tor but still).

Maximum protection should be on the gateway. I see why it could be bad to use NAT Network on the workstation though.

Read full topic
item.source: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network

item.title: Use NAT Network instead of NAT + Internal network
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Hello, welcome to Whonix forums and thank you for your question!

Trioxin:

We now have a fairly new feature in VB called NAT Network.

for reference: https://www.virtualbox.org/manual/ch06.html#network_nat_service

Trioxin:

This makes using 2 ifaces on the gateway redundant.

I don’t see the point for that. Two network interfaces is a a feature. Not a bug. No clearnet leak bugs reported ever at this time.

As a general guide on how to make the case, see also:

whonix.org – 10 Feb 20

Bug Reports and Software Development - Whonix

How to Report (Security) Bugs in the Whonix ™ Operating System. Software development cycle, patches, and responsiveness to feedback.

Trioxin:

I have both VMs set to NAT Network but now workstation can’t connect out.

For learning / experimenting OK but needless to say that in a production setup this could be a good way to introduce clearnet leaks.

Trioxin:

In the meantime, how can I successfully set it up this way for myself?

I doubt there can be an easy answer in 15 minutes as this would require extensive Whonix firewall changes.

See also:

whonix.org – 5 Nov 19

Whonix ™ Networking Implementation Documentation - Whonix

This page documents the differences between Debian and Whonix ™ related to networking.

Whonix Networking Implementation - Developer Documentation - Feedback Wanted! News
The diff between Debian buster and Whonix related to changes to network configuration. Whonix Networking Implementation - Developer Documentation was just now updated. On above page you can find all changes that Whonix applies related to networking: Location of the files on the disk in installed Whonix. The location of the file in Whonix source code on the disk. A link to the web version of the file on github. A comment if not installed by default gateway or workstation only Non-Qubes-Who…

Read full topic
